node.display_long_description:
Until You Fall is an arcade-inspired VR hack-and-slash roguelite that will force you to find and master your own fighting style for hours of frantic, kinetic fun.

Prepare for the fight of your life. Move your arms and body to the synthwave soundtrack as you attack, block, cast spells, and dodge your way deeper into the heart of a neon fantasy world filled with magic-infused monsters. Equip yourself with a variety of gameplay-altering weapons as you continue to gain strength and strike down the monstrosities that lurk throughout this mystifying world.

Features
+ Each run features randomized rewards, powerups, enemy configurations, and rooms - no two runs are quite the same
+ Arm yourself with a selection of powerful weapons and charge into battle with your own unique fighting style
+ Driving synthwave soundtrack keeps you moving in and out of the game
+ Customizable comfort and accessibility options help you move and battle comfortably in VR

The game is in English only.

node.reviewDescription:
It is important to know that my personal PSVR library contains 448 VR titles, I also have a YouTube chan "Todd the Futha Muckin Came Gat" where I review VR titles and do "Let's Play"s. With that out of the way I want all who read this to know I dont rate a title my personal #1 title without a dam good reason.
Until You Fall is the benchmark of VR gaming for many reasons. Not many games have managed to get it THIS right.
Engaging combat? Check.
Natural feeling controls? Check.
Great graphics? Check.
High polish? Check.
Amazing soundtrack and overall sound design? Check.
Unique and interesting weaponry? Check.
The ability to get a workout without it feeling like a chore? Check.
Engaging story? Check.
Awesome powerups? Check.
The ability to feel like a total bad a*s? Double Check.
The addictive nature that makes you just want to play "one more round" endlessly? Check.
Schell Games gave us something uniquely special in Until you Fall. This game caught me completely off gaurd..I went into it thinking I may enjoy it a bit but not at all my typical type of game so i didnt expect to like it much.
I couldnt have been more wrong. It literally took 15 mins of playing and it just blew my mind on so many levels leaving me impressed beyond belief and became my #1 all time favorite title. Between the music pumping you up, the satisfying melee combat and just the feeling of being some near god like warrior destroying all that gets in your way I've never had more fun with any other title. There is one downfall however. It set a benchmark of expectation that I now notice how many other similar and even AAA titles fall short in comparison now. I think this title came too early into VR, its ahead of it's time and makes most titles feel lacking now and at same time I wish I had it day 1 of entering VR gaming. 
If you are reading this and on the fence about purchasing it..dont be..this game is visual eye candy to the max on PSVR and Schell Games amazingly somehow made it look even better on the Quest 2. And the gameplay is so much better untethered on the Q2. Just jump in..once that music is pumping you up you'll soon be ready to unleash your inner warrior like never before.
